text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.
- The Portuguese government lost 42 billion escudos in the privatisation of steel products companies SN Planos and SN Longos.

- The government is preparing to launch a second fixed phone operator in a deal involving electricity company EDP, gas distributor Transgas, railways company CP and motorway company Brisa. The new company could start operations after the liberalisation of the Portuguese telecommunications sector on January 1 2000.
- French car company Renault is to invest 12 billion escudos in its factory in Cacia in central Portugal by 1999.
- Banco Portugues de Investimento (BPI) yesterday announced the launch of an issue of perpetual debt for 15.2 billion escudos.
- Banco Portugues de Investimento's (BPI) public offer to buy (OPA) for Banco de Fomento e Exterior (BFE) will take place on Lisbon bourse on December 10.

- Two international consortia led by Siemens and ABB-Asea Brown Boveri were chosen as finalists in the public competition to build a 130 billion escudos urban transport system in Oporto in northern Portugal, a management source in client company Sociedade do Metro do Porto told the paper.
- Around 1,000 Portuguese lorries are trapped in France as a result of road blocks set up by striking lorry drivers.
